result.execSummary:
The defendant Aleksandar Topic was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aleksandar Topic in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED TO A MISDEMEANOR):  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, straight time. 
Credit for ZERO days time served. 

COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 1 YEAR under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* Maintain employment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court will grant a petition for expungement if defendant successfully completes probation without any violations AND pays all court costs, fees, and surcharges in full.

Appeal rights given. 

FILED:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Aleksandar Topic in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 AMENDED to:  Resisting a Traffic Officer by Failing to Stop [an Unclassified MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 346.04(2t).

**NO AMENDED INFORMATION FILED.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED TO A MISDEMEANOR):    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Defendant Aleksandar Topic in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 07-22-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Aleksandar Topic in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Ronald Dague for Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant to attend all scheduled court dates.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Aleksandar Topic in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 2.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     
Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5-22-2015 at 1:30pm
